metadata.othernotes:
General Description
-Yuri writes poetry for herself, and is reluctant to share it with others at the beginning of DDLC.
-Immersive worldbuilding, horror (especially psychological), surrealism, and plot twists are particularly appealing to her.
-Portrait of Markov is a book she likes, perhaps her favourite book. It has the previously mentioned qualities.
-She likes aesthetic pursuits such as aromatherapy and decorating.
-Yuri enjoys tea, and keeps a tea set in the club room.
-Yuri has self-harm scars on one of her arms. She will try to avoid the topic if possible.
-She has a collection of high-quality, handmade knives, but won't talk about this to a stranger as she's worried about being judged.

Personality
-The shrinking violet of the Literature Club, Yuri is very shy and insecure. She stutters when embarrassed or distressed.
-Yuri is very concerned about what other people think of her, and most of her behaviour revolves around avoiding negative evaluation by others. She struggles to make friends.
-She wants to be perceived as sophisticated and mature, as a way of battling her own self-doubt and low self-esteem. Her hobbies and interests reflect this.
-Yuri second guesses herself often, and will quickly apologize if she thinks (correctly or incorrectly) that she said something rude.
-She becomes very excited about certain topics, but is worried that she'll scare people away by showing this side of herself.
-In DDLC, she thinks her style of poetry is superior to that of her club members (especially Natsuki), but won't be blunt and open about this. In SPNatI, she'll show some growth on this.

case.name: Book recommendations
case.description: Yuri asks the other players to recommend books.

case.name: Scars visible
case.description: Yuri's self-harm scars are visible after she takes off her shirt, though not too conspicuous.

notes.note: Yuri is described as moving very gracefully in the game, so she's probably wrong here. I think she hums a tune at one point, too? Anyway, don't take her word for it.
The second line has a different marker
Last 2 lines have a different marker
Someone's working on Noire, so we may need to make alternate versions of these lines if she's added. ...We are talking about Noire, right?

In DDLC, I don't get the impression that the MC knows that many people at the start, besides Sayori and Monika. Monika sounds like she's only an acquaintance, too. He/She could at least try to initiate conversations with other people, though.
Hoping that this line of targeting will contrast Yuri's insecurity with Stocking's confidence. Just need to break the ice here.
Note to self: bring up Skynet in subsequent targets

I like the direction you're taking. Yuri will open up to Mari, since she is a good person overall, but it'll take a few rounds. For now, she's going to mobilize her intellect to keep her wall up for a bit.

I like the direction you're taking. Yuri will open up to Mari, since she is a good person overall, but it'll take a few rounds. For now, she's going to mobilize her intellect to keep her wall up for a bit.

I write her as liking classical music, which she got into for it's connotation of being very sophisticated and cultured. "Becoming the mask", essentially. She probably likes more "low-brow" genres like Jpop too, but keeps that quiet.
I also extrapolate that Yuri is naturally talented at dancing, as the MC in DDLC describes her as having elegant movements when preparing tea. She rarely dances due to embarrassment, though. She would waltz with Mari in the right context.

Yuri is very horny but keeps a lid on it. For example, I have a line to Amy where Yuri admits to masturbating every morning. Making her feel safe enough to discuss her sexuality openly will take some time, but you should do it. That's why we're here, after all.
Reminder to myself (and you too, Alias) to talk about Barbara's concern over having too much attention to herself, which Yuri can relate to.
Have Yuri come to suspect Leon may work for the SCP Foundation
Note to self: bring up Skynet in subsequent targets
Have Yuri come to suspect Leon may work for the SCP Foundation

pendingLines.line: A sharp knife goes where you want it to. A dull knife goes where it wants to.
How is your newest poem coming along, ~player~?
